Didn't find any existing bugs that exactly match this; the error is being automatically reported so I unfortunately do not have a set of repro steps:

Rob, can you elaborate on how it's automatically reported?  Are there any more clues such as which project is being closed or which file (if it is a file) is being released?

BEA's WTP-based product includes some logic that will auto-report certain categories of exceptions - all you typically get is the stack trace and the build info (the user usually fails to add any other helpful information about the "crash"). So, unfortunately, I do not know the project or document context.
